column4: I got an odd error when trying to install skype with sudo apt-get install skype. it says package skype is not available but is referred to by another backage.
*package
I just did sudo apt-get purge skype, and I removed the .Skype folder. Then I restarted and tried to reinstall it.
any ideas on installing skype?
I didn't...how do I do that LordXenu
in synaptic my skype-common is green meaning that it is installed right?
how can that be if I just did a purge?
so how do I "just grab the .deb" from skype....I'm not that good yet..
I'd love to learn though.
.deb is like .exe in Winblows World.
Yup. Grab the file. Double-click on it. Watch it installing right before your eyes and away you go.
I remember a factoid about using older version but I can't find it. It should be okay.
thanks for the links!
Perhaps cheese or skype.
I am having problems with my built in microphone on my HP laptop. I'm looking for an alternative.
You might want to run `apt-get -f install' to correct these.

i tried the sudo apt-get install, and it looked like it installed without errors. then when I did sudo apt-get update, I got the same error about unmet dependencies. it seems like I'm not getting usbmuxd and libusbmuxd1 to install or somthing.
Try installing the packages?
I tried with sudo apt-get install libusbmuxd1 usbmuxd. it aparently didn't work.
For what app? I don't see libusbmux in the repo.

I used a repo for connecting my ipod touch from here: sudo add-apt-repository ppa:pmcenery/ppa...Here is the full printout of what I got as a response to sudo apt-get -f install.  http://ubuntu.pastebin.com/d6d6c2fc3
